description: From German Kitsch, from dialectal kitschen (“to coat, to smear”); the word and concept were popularized in the 1930s by several critics who contrasted it with avant garde art.

adjectives.description: kitsch (comparative kitscher or more kitsch, superlative kitschest or most kitsch)

entries.meaning: Of art and decor: of questionable aesthetic value; excessively sentimental, overdone or vulgar.
Art, decorative objects, and other forms of representation of questionable artistic or aesthetic value; a representation that is excessively sentimental, overdone, or vulgar.
